page.title: 18LOCAL NEWS _ JULY, 1985.
page.content: The Scout Hut committee is raising money to build a new Scout Hut. They have recently received a cheque for Â£8,500 from a well-wisher. Five new houses have been built at the bottom of Bradford. Six houses are being built on Conksbury Lane and my Dad is complaining because they will overlook our house. Recently 250 fish were stolen from the fish farm at Alport. The Waterworks Committee is putting new plastic water pipes in because the old ones are rotting and getting clogged up with dirt. A teacher is leaving the school because there are not enough children coming in. A collection in the village to raise money to buy televisions for the Royal Chesterfield Hospital raised Â£775. Douglas Oldham (11)
